Reviews.Title: “The Poet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luistico
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone in the Poet Hotel. The renovation of this hotel has been perfectly done, the family was great for us 4, not noisy at all, and we really appreciated our arrival withthis smiling guy ! Breakfast was a bit poor for us, but sufficiant anyway. Very well located in the heart of the Museum Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Poet perfection”
Reviews.Author: Susan L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel this was superb. The family room was spacious and clean. The staff was excellent and friendly and the breakfast was adequate. It is set in a nice location with trams a minute away and the centre a 15 minute walk. Only drawbacks are that noise from other guests can disturb your sleep as the walls are not very thick and I would have liked tea/coffee making facilities. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Acro - Great budget hotel in a quiet are of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 85Alan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very good for what I paid. Basic but clean and in a nice and quiet area of Amsterdam. Walking to many parts of amsterdam was in my opinion very easy. I walked it to Central station in under half an hour which I belive was the other side of the city. The staff at the hotel were very friendly as were pretty much all the duch people I come across. The hotel had a little bar whcih was good to finish off the night. Breakfast was conitinental and I thought was very good. The heiniken experience isnt too far from the hotel and is well worth a tour. If i return to Amsterdam I shall certainly consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Group Tour”
Reviews.Author: Colleensbiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was accommodating, but if you are more than two in a room (which many of us were), 3rd and 4th guest get uncomfortable chair bed/coffin. The rooms were tiny, and the shower, although powerful, would not remain appointing down once turned on, so the entire shower room was blasted with water each time! This was only funny the first time! The staff were tolerant of students (27 of them), and the atmosphere was relaxed and laid back. It's close to the main tram and not a long walk from Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Poet / Acro”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Still a good hotel post face-lift. The new rooms are small but adequate. Breakfast is still good. The bar has become very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good !”
Reviews.Author: Dafna T
Reviews.Content: Hotel look a bit old , However we got newly renovated tiny room , very clean . Good location Very nice staff Good value for money, would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: CONS: Walls are paper thin & you can here people talking outside on the street & sidewalk. Found a long dark hair in one of my towels. Beds are very uncomfortable. Bathroom was very very small. Shower was extremely tiny & the shower curtain would stick to me whenever I took a shower. For the type of room I got, the price was way expensive. I expected a lot more for the price. The Breakfast was cold cuts, sliced cheese, bread, cereal, orange juice, water and coffee. If you like eating a sandwich for breakfast then stay here. PROS: Staff was friendly and accommodating

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Steph R
Reviews.Content: Clean, good power showers, friendly staff, excellent location. Highly recommend it. Superb value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: magicfairy444
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel , the room was clean and had everything you needed in it. i must admit it was pretty cramped and it did take a bit of skill to get dressed in the morning and the walk way down the side of the bed was very narrow. it did also mean the bed felt quite cramped as one side was against the wall i found myself headbutting the wall all night. but the way i look at it is at least it was clean and it is just to sleep in. the stairs to get to the rooms were challenging very narrow and steep especially with a big traveling backpack on ! it was about a 10 minute walk to the the centre of amsterdam but it was a nice walk. lots of resturants and bars within the area. the hotel was located on a very quiet leafy street which was nice.. in general this was a very nice hotel. the staff seemed friendly (didnt really have much dealing with them) . breakfast was nice general buffet toasts cerals cheese etc the room once again was quite cramped. all in all a nice basic hotel

Reviews.Title: “My trial trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Alexander R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a great place to have a nice staying in Amsterdam for a holiday or just a business trip. A combination of its delicious meals, high-level accomodations, cultural and adventure activities, friendly atmosphere and a sweet treat makes your trip to be unforgetable and cosy in every way. From its clean air to its dazzling local meal service your staying revels the fine classical traditions of Dutch culture and the right way of living. Having a good location in the centre (not far from the Museumplein station) you can visit in a two minutes walk the Museum of Van Gogh, The Gebouw or the Koninlijke Museum or just go windown-shopping in one on the citys most exclusive diamond shop like The Coster diamonds.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonable priced”
Reviews.Author: venkiteshsam
Reviews.Content: During christmas which is last month December 2011, I stayed in this hotel just for 2 nights and it was really comfortable in all aspects, the staff, the food, the service, the cleanliness and so on. Though it's just been refurbished but they made it to complete at the right time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Duststorm
Reviews.Content: There does appear to be a reasonable amount of criticism made against this hotel, and whilst it is very basic, it still should be considered if on a budget. Yes, the rooms are small and the bathrooms a little cramped, however to its credit, they are clean and reasonably comfortable, Quite simply, if you want a hotel with a little luxury, you will need to look elsewhere and be prepared to pay more, however if you are looking for a well located, no - frills hotel of good value, then this certainly deserves consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel Well Located To Explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Guy C
Reviews.Content: While small, rooms are quite functional and comfortable. I was there for two nights in January and found it a good value, close to the tramline, museums and restaurants. Quiet tree lined street with beautiful period architecture. Not for people with mobility problems or expectations of 5 star ammenities, recommended for the adverturous at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean stay for the young traveller”
Reviews.Author: rocape
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms in central Amsterdam. Good hotel for the young traveller that needs a bed, bathroom and breakfast. Rooms are small but comfortable and clean. If you want to party all night and only need a place to crash for the night then Acro is great. There is no lift and stairs are steep, old and unfit avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate as a base to explore but rooms oh so small”
Reviews.Author: FTVS
Reviews.Content: OK; the point is you're not going to spend a lot of time in your hotel so on that basis, this is a good value place to explore. The tram is nearby and Leidesplein and museums a short walk. It is scrupolously clean and teh showers are good. However, the room and bathroom were absolutely tiny so 2 of you getting dressed at the same time just wasn't do-able. Noise insulation is poor so you can hear everyone else moving around and talking. I would probably go back but more than two nights I would go elsewhere due to the lack of space.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel; well located”
Reviews.Author: Cargi1208
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Hotel Acro is not great. There's a flight of steps upto the entrance of the hotel and no sign of help for lifting heavy suitcases. hotel lobby is pretty dingy as well. HOWEVER, give it a chance and get to the rooms and they are modern, light, white and bright with comfy beds, good showers and free internet. Add to that an excellent continental breakfast that's included in the price and Hotel Acro is a good find for budget travellers. It's located 5 minutes walk from the 2 major museums and its a short hop on the tram to the old centre of Amsterdam and the canals. Staff are friendly and helpful. Only downside is minimal sound proofing and noisy revellers in the corridors until midnight. Would stay there again for the budget .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location for an Average Budget Hotel; Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte H
Reviews.Content: TRIP This was our first trip to Amsterdam, we travelled as a couple aged 20 and 18 for a 20th Birthday in February 2011. I booked the hotel online through the DFDS site which had a deal on for two nights on the ferry and one in Amsterdam. As there was a budget the Acro Hotel was the first picked from the list for being within budget and having great reviews. ROOMS The reviews stated that the rooms were small and basic, which was true, but didn't matter as we were only there for a night. We stayed on the ground floor of the hotel which looked out onto a backyard piled with rubbish - so we kept the curtains drawn. The room was basic and consisted of; a double bed, TV on the wall, mirror and wardrobe. The bathroom was well planned out and practical, about 2-3m long, it had a toilet at one end and shower cubicle at the other separated by a mirror. Power shower when full blast applied definitely wakes you up after a ferry and bus ride! STAFF The men on reception were extremely helpful and even let us leave our bags there on the last day free of extended stay charges whilst we explored the city. There was a slight glitch when we went to collect our bags in the form of a power cut, but again the staff proved their excellent customer service by loaning us torches and allowing us to use separate rooms for toiletry purposes. LOCATION The location was great; not too far a walk from the main attractions, but far enough out of the main bustle of stag and hen do's. At the end of the road was the Rijksmuseum and 'Amsterdam Sign' which is a great photo opportunity. At the other end of the road was the House of Bols and designer shops including Chanel. On the first night we were a little lost and using a guide map managed to find the city centre (be aware of pick-pocketers), which is just past the Hard Rock CafÃ© about 5 minute walk from the hotel. In the centre there are theatres, restaurants, McDonald's (be prepared to pay for the toilet in McDonald's, as with most eateries in Amsterdam), supermarkets and shops like H&M and Pandora as well as tram line connections around Amsterdam. A 10-15 further walk into the city there's Madame Tussads, well worth a visit for visitors of all ages. Alternatively a 15 minute walk from the hotel or 5 minute tram ride from the centre in between the variety of coffee shops is the Red Light District. A part of the Europe that really has to be visited at night â€“ if not squeamish of bikini clad women paraded behind glazing or an individual prone to giggles. We spent some time in one of the pubs in the centre of the Red Light District, with budget prices of 2 â€“ 4 Euro considering the location! OVERALL This hotel did the job: 1 night in decent enough a hotel in Amsterdam on a budget. Impressed by the bonuses of; helpful staff, budget price and great location, I'd definitley book the Acro Hotel again for another adventure in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Atrotter
Reviews.Content: I was very positively surprised about Acro Hotel in Amsterdam. Typically small hotels in Amsterdam have narrow and steep staircases to the rooms and not so good bathrooms. This hotel had a lift, renewed bathrooms, 24/7 reception, a good breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. The location was good and peaceful, just next door to the National Museum. There was even a small pub in the hotel. Maybe the best small hotel I've stayed in Amsterdam. Ps. The hotel is going to change the name to Poet something in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Took me back to my youth hostel days”
Reviews.Author: Tommytuck
Reviews.Content: Room was SO small - little more than a corridor. Walls paper thin so choose your neighbours well -You hear everything. Reception and stairs grubby. Bar was nice but be prepared fo wait as barman also mans reception. Breakfast room in basement basic but ok food. Good location awayfrom fhe crowds . This is a budget hotel - not for those wanting to do anything but sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped hotel good prices”
Reviews.Author: Ashwath
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, good location near Rijks Museum. Cramped rooms, small bathrooms, reasonably priced, not handicapped friendly, steep and narrow stairs. very small breakfast room with mediocre breakfast. Small but nice bar, free wifi works well, staff friendly and efficient. Very close to tram station for easy access to Center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Central ,good value, friendly”
Reviews.Author: annapart
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel within easy walking distance in to the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms were small but clean ,smelt good , were modern and beds are very comfy even for a bad back! Steep stairs but lift available. Staff very friendly and helpful. Very accomodating. A very good choice, friends reccomended it would happily reccomend on.Not great if you have young kids or need lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Clean and silent rooms. Very polite staff. The location is excellent. The hotel is located in the middle of museums square. 10 minutes to the center by bike or trum. Also you have a bus from the nearest bus stop to the airport. The breakfast was also very nice. Rooms are very small, but it is ok for couples like us. Also the rooms are very clean and all equipment is new. We are very pleased with this hotel and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tigerseye42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for a few days for my birthday in november. The weather was great for that time of year but the heating was pretty spot on. There was a bit of refurbishing going on @ the time but the work was restricted to during the day when guests would probably be out. The room we had was the old style of room and was a little dated. However it was no problem for us. The beds were clean and comfortable, shower room was small (would NOT be suitable for a largeish person) but the shower always had hot water. The neighbourhood is lovely :-) Some very pretty architecture in the locality & the Rijkmuseum right on the corner of the street! It was an absolute doddle getting here from the airport and the fact that the diamond museums and exclusive shops are in the next streets tells you it's pretty safe. Or at least on a shedload of CCTV. The tram stop is 2m away and takes you right up to Dam square. The guys on reception were great. Very knowledgeable and couldn't do enough to help. Did not buy drinks in the hotel so I cannot comment on prices. Breakfast was the standard cereal & rolls stuff, but that suited us fine. I would definitely stay here again & can't wait to bring my other half. There are plenty of restaurants in the local area or 5mins away. Lovely italian meals were had, and there was a wagamama in the chess square behind the hard rock cafe. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Sarsenet
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel very close to the museum area of Amsterdam and handy for bus 197 to/from the airport. Rooms appear to be renovated: mine had a flat-screen TV, new shower and wooden floor. Room was very small, but fine for just one night. If I was sharing it would be a tight squeeze though. Room was also too hot and I couldn't open the window, Breakfast was nice, with a good selection of items and plenty of space to sit down at a table.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dynamite155
Reviews.Content: We have stopped here a couple of times. Its in a great location near the Museums and Trams. Its a nice quiet area with the posh shopping street behind it, and its not far to walk to the main square. There is a little bar which is nice. I suggest you down early for breakfast as when its gone its gone. Very helpful friendly guys on reception, nothing is a problem. The rooms are quite small but you are not in them for long.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnDTP
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and modern, though narrow. Everything worked. Shower was small but adequate. Fine free wireless access. Service was friendly and competent. Breakfast had good choices. Some noise at night, perhaps from a radiator. Good location on a quiet, pretty street. Easy access to trams, buses, bike rental, and nearby attractions like the Rijksmuseum, Vondelpark, and Leidseplein. Overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “clean, newly renovated”
Reviews.Content: this is a 2-star hotel but is clean, newly renovated rooms so all is fresh, and the location is easy access to all. staff are either business cordial or very friendly, depending on who happens to be working. the small bar is convenient for the night's lasts beer. watch out for the stairs...take the lift. as in all amsterdam staircases, this one is very steep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but you won't be able to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: samikrimmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a mixture of good and bad really. The rooms are very basic. But the walls are extremely thin and a German couple next door were having sex from midnight to 7am so we didn't get any sleep at all!!!! However, the location is really good as the tram stop is only a 3 min walk and the hotel staff are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Deal for the price !!”
Reviews.Author: DeccanTravels
Reviews.Content: Was recommended to me by go-today.com correspondent and boy it turned out to be a great choice ! Great location. Very close to the museums, tram station !!. Room was a bit narrow but very clean. Facilities are good. Food is good too. The hotel staff were very professional nice. We arrived from NY in early hours and even though our reservation didn't start until later in the day, we were allowed to keep the luggage in cloak room. Since the museums were walking distance we chose to visit them until we got the room. We were given room an hour before the actual start time !!!.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BUDGET HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: lisac035
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the Acro Hotel in Amsterdam and for the price you pay you really cant complain. Firstly we arrived early Saturday and our room were not ready however we could sit in the bar and wait. Stephen on reception was very nice and always helpul. I had a twin room and this was cleaned every day, fresh towells etc. Lovely bathroom, shower etc. It is walking distance to museums and the square. Great Location. I didnt have breakfast which was included as I prefered to go out however my friend did say it was good with tea/coffee, cheese, cold meat, orange juice etc. The hotel is being renovated however I was not there enough in the day to hear anything. If it is a clean, nice, hotel at a budget price then I would highly reccomend. I would definately stay there again as would my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammyhols
Reviews.Content: Travelled there with my partner and arrived very very early...guy on reception very helpful...took our bags from us and stored them in secure place. We arrived about 5 hours before we could check in so was offered city map told which trams and buses went where and best places to go for a couple of hours until our room was ready. Rooms are small and narrow but perfectly adequate and clean and nothing is too much trouble for the guys on reception. Breakfast also, is perfectly nice...nothing hot but lots to choose from and very very clean. Easy to find from city centre infact its on a lovely residential street so very quiet. Definately recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for explore Amsterdam's museums and city.”
Reviews.Author: Couplecamp
Reviews.Content: The Acro hotel is very well located. The Van Gogh's museum is just around the corner. The neighbourhood is safe and silent. There are a lot of restaurants and fancy shops one block up the hotel. The rooms are tight, but they are very clean, well decorated and cousy. The breakfast is very good with good options as fruits, breads, juices and cheeses. The staff is very helpful, with a good english and can give you information about the transportation, food and culture as well. I've been there with my wife and was a great stay. P.S.: The lift without inner door is a pitoresque point. Very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “acro-amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: manda19869493
Reviews.Content: Great for a short stay, clean, warm and friendly..loads of stairs and very small lift. Rooms are a little small but got what you need in them, it was only a short break but I wouldn't want to stay there for a week. breakfast was ok, not cooked breakfast but it was edible, meats, cheeses, cereal, toast and hard boiled eggs with tea/coffee/juice. Value for money and near tram stop to get into the centre

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: mems1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in November. Our room was small but it was fine. Very very clean, cleaners would come in every day. Weather was freezing however the room was always really warm. Breakfast was good, just what you need and would expect. Close the the museums and a very posh shopping street, Gucci, Louis Vuitton etc. Will definately be staying here again. Dont let the reviews about small rooms put you off. Yes we have a few bruises from stepping over the corner of the bed but its definately value for money compared to some other hotels. There was a double bed and a seperate dressing area if you like with a dressing table, chairs and enough room for large suitcases and to move about comfortably. There is a TV in the room but we never even bothered to swtich it on. Hair dryer in the bathroom so dont waste your suitcase space taking one!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, good value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: M_Birchall
Reviews.Content: Near to the Van Gogh museum Rijksmuseum, Vondespark and Liedesplein and well out of the dodgy part of town (though still within walking distance of a coffeeshop should you fancy some cannabis) the Acro is a nice enough hotel in an old Amsterdam 5 story building. The building is very charming though be careful of the bannisters on the stairs as I managed to get a nasty splinter one night. Rooms are rather small though very clean and comfortable enough. The bathrooms in some rooms are extremely small (specifically room 202, though the bathrooms in 204 and 209 were of a decent size). I'm a big guy and I had to shave with the bathroom door open so that I could fit in front of the sink. 3 of our party managed to bump our heads on the TV shelves in our rooms though as were out most of the day small room size wasn't a big problem. It's a budget hotel in Amsterdam so obviously prone to lively groups of young people holidaying together. The sound proofing isn't great and the beds can be a little creaky so not exactly the place for a romantic getaway. Breakfast is self service in the normal Dutch style and what it lacked in choice it made up for in quantity and quality. All the staff except one were extremely friendly and the only grumpy one was a deadpan comedic genius and still helpful enough. I was a bit disappointed we didn't see him again after the first day. Would definitely stay here again if in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: WJanzen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is converted from an older building on a street of row houses, likely from the 19th century (newer for Amsterdam). It is just south of the system of semi-circular canals that make up the old core of Amsterdam, and is practically next door to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. I really liked the location this hotel. It is on a tree-lined street that is very quite, mostly residential, and has very little traffic. It feels like Brooklyn Heights or the older portions of the Upper East Side. And yet as soon as you start working north from this area, you begin to enter the core areas of the old city. The Leidesplein area, which is thick with bars, restaurants, and shops is basically a couple of blocks away, but none of its commotion is evident from this hotel's quiet street. Continue north the Leidesplein to explore the rest of Amsterdam. The downsides of this hotel also stem to the fact that it's an older building. Rooms are quite small. My double was about 2 meters / 7 feet wide, leaving about 45 cm / 18 inches to walk by the double bed. Rooms also don't have great sound separation, so you should talk to your neighbors and kindly ask them to refrain from sex during your stay. But these little rooms are clean and have a modern minimalist design which I liked. And the free Wi-Fi internet, a great benefit, was fast and reliable. I made calls to the US on Skype using the free internet connection and it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are on a budget and are only staying a couple of nights. We stayed here for 1 nt as part of a Dfds cruise minibreak and it was ideal. The location was not bad. Great for being close to the Van Gaugh museum & also the leidseplein where you will find plenty of bars, restaurants & a cpl of clubs but quite a distance from Dam Square. It took us about 50min - 1hr to walk (slowly) to Dam Square but you could get tram 1, 3 or 5 which would take you directly there. There is a market not far from the hotel which was fantastic, it sold everything you could imagine at a very cheap price! The rooms at the hotel were quite small but clean and I found the beds to be very comfy! The breakfast was ok, toast, ham, cheese, boiled egg, cereal, yoghurt & fruit. Not bad to start you off for the day! I would defo recommend this hotel for mostly everyone except people with walking difficuilty as the steps at the entrance of the hotel were the steepest I have experienced but overall it is a good little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very narrow beds, but a good location”
Reviews.Author: A380fan
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, just next ot the Van Gogh Museum. Staff friendly. Very steep steps going up to the reception from the street, and also going up to the rooms. The room was clean, however, it was very long and thin, which was a bit weird. The biggest problem was, however, the narrow beds. Looking at them, they look normal, but once in bed, you realise that they are seriously narrow. Unless you lie straight on the bed, and don't move at all, you're going to be uncomfortable. Breakfast was very busy, but food ok. If the beds were a normal width, I'd definately reccomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a 2 ** hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evamaya
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for a few days and booked our hotel room at the tourist information right in front of the central station. It was the cheapest room for 3 people that they could offer us so we took it. From the outside it doesn't look very charming but ok for a 2 ** hotel. The stairs to the lobby and to the rooms are very steep but there's also an elevator (at least from the lobby to the rooms). The guy at the reception was friendly and gave us a quick instruction where to find what (room, restaurant, etc.) The room was adequate for 2 **, I would say it's rather something for students or travelling friends than for families or couples. The beds are pretty low and the bathroom is very small, especially the toilet room. We had the breakfast included so we went to the restaurant twice. There was different toast (dark, whole grain, white), rusk toast, crispbread, cheese, ham, salami, different cereals, yogurt, jams, nutella, honey, butter, coffee, cocoa and tea. All in all a pretty good selection. The stay was ok but for somebody who's used to 3 *** hotels I wouldn't recommend going there. For backpackers or students it might be recommendable. An absolut advantage was the free wireless access and the central location right in the museum's district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fine for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: iwouldgoouttonight
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent spot, close to shops, parks, pubs/clubs and the tram line. I do agree with previous reviews in that the rooms are pretty small, but for a weekend break thats all you need. It is basic, but I found the staff to be friendly, the room and toilet clean and the overall service recieved value for money. If you are only planning on a short stay Id recommend this hotel due to its fab location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book on hoteliers (the internet) unless you have phoned and checked the price at the hotel first!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sued55
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel 2 days before we arrived through hoteliers on the internet and were quoted a price of 110 euros. When we got to the hotel the price of the room for that night was posted as 75 euros. Because we booked online we were told we had to pay the 110 euros. If we had phoned the hotel rather than booked online we would have gotten the lower price (that's what our friends had done). We felt that we were being punished for booking ahead and online. As far as the hotel was concerned it was clean (although one of our pillow cases was ripped) and the breakfast was quite good and included a number of options. The room was VERY small but the bed was comfortable and there was a bathroom in the room. When we walked into the lobby I noticed a distinct odour of cigarette smoke. Unfortunately though, our stay at the hotel was not particularly positive because we felt were treated poorly when we tried to talk to them about the price of the room. The whole experience has taught me to check with the hotel as well as online before i book through hoteliers again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: beppy
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Hotel Acro was 12 years ago and because we had a large airy room and the hotel is in an excellent location we decided to go back again this year-------what a disappointment. We were given a double room on the third floor and our hearts sank when we walked into it. The first impression is that this is a single room with a double bed squashed up against the wall so consequently the unfortunate sleeping against the wall has to slide down the bed to get out. The space alongside the bed is so narrow that one of us had to stand at the bottom of the bed to allow the other to pass down the room to the tiny bathroom. At the foot of the bed there is a small space which holds a shelf and two upright wooden dining type chairs, a hanging space for clothes but no drawers, so all in all a depressing room which we dreaded returning to in the evening. Another couple showed us their twin room which too was awful, this room was more like a corridor and the beds could only go lengthwise along the wall with the back of one headboard up against the back of the other, with again a narrow strip of floor to manouvre around. I'm surprised DFDS still make use of this hotel ------I wonder if they have inspected it lately?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Missmor
Reviews.Content: I researched this hotel before going on my trip with DFDS seaways to Amsterdam, and couldn't believe that not one reviewer failed to mention that the street behind it is the most expensive shopping street in amsterdam, with chanel, tiffanys, cartier, dior gucci and more! The location of this hotel was superb as it was in a safe, quiet neighbourhood and only 5 minute walk from the leidesplen where there are lots of cafes and bars including hard rock cafe and boom chicago (good for those who wish to do the amazing st nicholas boat tour) there is a tram stop around the corner and also the famous i am amsterdam artwork. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were very clean and spacious for the price. The breakfast included in the price was lovely and overall i would thouroughly recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “quiet place, close to vondel park,leidse,musium!”
Reviews.Author: kazy2
Reviews.Content: i strongly recommend this hotel! it was hard to find a hotel in weekend. the most hotel was 90euro and the one that i staied in before here was 80 euro for a single small room. and i was backpacking so some dudes told me to better check hostels. but finally i found where i should be. hotel acro is just near vondel park. single room but large bed with tv,clean room, clean bath room! and cheap!! very quiet place and also close to leidse square. if you wanna hang around near central station, it takes 15min by walk but i prefer sleep in a quiet place. and there are many restaurants 5min walk from here. i staied in here for one night but i would stay in here when i get back in amsterdam. service is good. actually i forgot my WALLET under the pillow! I went back to the hotel and they just notified that it was me and gave me back with big smile. i miss this area. peaceful area, valuable,convinient, good service!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: aditi_wanchoo
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget trip to Amsterdam for 3 nights and stayed at Hotel Acro. Would definitely recommend it for the following reasons: 1. Good value for money (book in advance and get a good deal) 2. Fantastic location - a 5 minute walk from Leidseplein which is a bustling lively square full of bars/cafes/clubs/restaurants/street performers and the like. 3. Plentiful breakfast 4. Pleasant service - friendly staff 5. Cute clean room The location is the icing on the cake and we would love to come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky hotel for anyone”
Reviews.Author: danthe7th
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here with the DFDS Mini Cruise package and were pleasantly surprised. Staff were more than helpful and the room was quite spacious. Breakfast wasnt great as their was limited space, and the stairs in the hotel are pretty steep, but overall a fantastic place. Planning to go to Amsterdam again and would seriously consider Acro. Right in the middle of the Fashion and museum district and easily accessible via the Canal Bus service (additional charge) but offers a great walk from the hotel to the station and central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: Pelagic_Gypsy
Reviews.Content: I had to make last minute changes to my plans to stay in Amsterdam and was looking for a hotel for 3 nights. I selected this hotel based on reviews, and it's location. While the room was small, it was comfortable. I slept well each night, and enjoyed the free breakfast each morning. I would certainly consider staying here next time I am in Amsterdam. The wireless internet worked great too.

Reviews.Title: “Good but dishonest housekeeping staff soured the stay”
Reviews.Author: AmbieLondon
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms and good breakfast but be weary of leaving anything behind in the rooms. I had a dress go missing from the room and despite numerous attempts to discuss the matter with the hotel I left without recovering it. They have also ignored my follow-up emails.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: The Acro is not fancy. It is very basic, and most of the rooms are tiny. But the location is amazing - steps from Museumplein, PC Hooftstraat, Vondelpark, and a tram stop. Staff are friendly and helpful, and the rates are fantastic. If you don't require featherbeds and plasma TVs, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Been there and loved it”
Reviews.Author: liza6
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nites for my partners 50th birthday with my parents aswell the hotel is clean friendly and in a great location . stairs r steep going 2 breakfast but soon get used to them .theres a lift to the rooms so no problems there.Staff r spot on ,cant do enough for you .When we got home got in touch with our travell agent to make sure they recomend this hotel to others cuz we,ll definately be back .

Reviews.Title: “Great location- safe, clean environment”
Reviews.Author: 2010newlyretired
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the ACRO kind of by accident, as we were "volcano refugees" looking for a place to stay. There is a very steep flight of stairs to reach the lobby. There are also steep circular stairs within the building, but there is a lift to reach all floors except the breakfast room. They have an area to store luggage to accommodate early arrivals or checkouts, though it is not secured. It did not appear that our luggage was tampered with in any way. We were there for 4 nights, and although the room was very small, it was very clean and we were grateful to have a roof over our heads. I saw the comment about not having a bar of soap; but to be fair, there was a foam soap dispenser near the sink, as well as in the shower. We did buy a bar of soap for both showering/laundry purposes, but I can't fault the Acro. The walls were very thin, you could hear conversations in the adjacent rooms, but again, people weren't screaming, so it all blended into the background. The breakfast room was very cramped, but the food was fresh and suitable. Not gourmet, but wholesome fare - something for everyone. The location was GREAT, so close to the museums and half a block from the tram line. We bought a 96 hour tram pass for $19 euro, and rode around town like crazy. Was great when our arms were full from shopping; we even stopped back mid-day for a change of shoes/socks because the location was so handy. Even though by US standards you could argue that the hotel was expensive, by Amsterdam standards it was real value. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and breakfast but bring earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: Tab_London
Reviews.Content: The Good: Located near the museums and the Vondelpark (looked amazing in the snow). It's ona quiet side street so no outside traffic and a tram stop is at the end of the road. The concierge was helpful and the breakfast was top quality. The Bad: There's internet access through a PC opposite the concierge. Don't use it - ever! It's painfully slow and very overpriced. The walls of the room are paper thin and there was a constant dripping noise from the ceiling - must be a leaky roof as it was raining at the time. Thankfully I brought earplugs so was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great breakfast....very pleased on all fronts!”
Reviews.Author: suz-cara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights...family of 5 including young teenagers. Had done a lot of research but wanting something relatively cheap but still convenient, clean, safe area, etc. had opted for this hotel. As we were on a time limited break we didn't want to lose a lot of time travelling in and out from the suburbs. Also, we didn't want to pay a premium for all of the leisurecentre/restaurant/furnishings trappings of a much larger "chain" hotel....we were going to see Amsterdam, not to spend our time in a hotel. We were really happy with the Acro choice and would certainly stay there again. Location was excellent..the Riksmuseum and Vangogh only around the corner, the big Albert Cuyp market less than 5 mins away, and the Leisdesplein with all its restaurants just 2 mins walk....kids loved the HardRockCafe. We walked to Ann Franks in about 15-20 mins and didn't find we needed to take trams anywhere, even though there is a stop just around the corner from the hotel. From Schipol was easy with a short train to the Zuid station followed by a no. 5 tram to the Hobbemass stop at the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and happy to make recommendations and to let us leave our luggage on the last day after we checked out. We also saved some money with the free discount cards they had. The breakfast was busy and beats a lot of what we've had as "continental" breakfasts in other places...there were cereals, eggs, cheeses, breads, salami, juice and so on....plenty to fill up on for the day...an advantage was the late finish time of 10am. The stairs were steep but there was a lift inside the hotel, and our two rooms were spotlessly clean and warm and big enough for us as we weren't in them during the day. There were TVs which we didn't use and the ensuite showers were good. Our only interrupted sleep one night was some people talking loudly on their way to their room but I've encountered that in many much more expensive hotels and I can't fault this hotel for that....there always seem to be the odd inconsiderate person. Overall, very much a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Thin Walls, Average Bed”
Reviews.Author: schizophrenic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days. The location is really good. It is very near to the museums and to tram track 5. However, if you're coming back late, the road can be rather quiet and dark. The walls are really thin. Could hear neighbours coming in at 3-4am making a lot of noise. The bed wasn't that comfortable but it is acceptable for the price. At the very least, breakfast was provided. The receptionist was very nice and helpful. However, you have to return the hotel key everytime you leave the hotel. Troublesome but I can live with that. If you're on a budget and you're interested in Amsterdam, this is a reasonable place to stay. At least you do not have to share a bathroom with strangers and the room is all to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lloydgeorge
Reviews.Content: Lovely old building located very close to the Reijksmuseum (about two minutes), restaurants, and tram stops. Good choice of breakfast, pleasant and mostly helpful staff and good bar! Excellent for student trips or parties with mixed age groups- may not be so good for disabled or those with babies- there are fairly steep steps up to the hotel entrance. But maybe there is an alternative entrance-I don't know. The hotel has a lift. Bedrooms are clean and fairly basic, but all facilities seemed to be in working order, and the shower (also quite basic) was lovely after a day of walking. Wireless available, and the hotel sells tram tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: lopats
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Acro in Jan of this year. We caught the connexxion shuttle from the shippol airport at a cost of 14 euro each. Just to note that we were waiting on the bus, and asked a taxi driver how much he would charge to take us there and he quoted 140 euro!! The hotel is in a residential area the the tram stop to dam square / central station is turn left out of the hotel and take the next right and the stop is just there. The hotel itself is in a great location. The rooms were clean and very warm. There was plenty of hot water and the brekkie was fine and plenty of it there for every one. there would be an issue with disabled people due to the amount of stairs in the place so might be worth keeping in mind that there is a lift in the premises. There is a bar in the hotel that sells beer and coffee's etc and we spent a couple of hours here. The Vondelpark is right accross the road and worth a stroll. Overall we enjoyed this hotel. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and nothing seemed to be any trouble to them (in fact i think they should advertise the staff as a "pro" on the web site!!). We loved amsterdam and tried to do as much as we possibly could. Cant recommend the city enough for any one as there is some thing for every one here. Cant wait to go back. And would stay in thie hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jma83
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in January. Was a great location and easy to get to (we found the best way was train from the airport to Central Station, then trams (either two or five) leave straight outside there. If you get of at a stop starting with H it's just around the corner! Room was fine, clean, warm etc, only problem was how thin the walls must have been! Quite noisy and were woken up by a baby yelling both nights and it did not shut up! Other than that, great for the price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Acro hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliverP7
Reviews.Content: excellent rooms not badly priced the lift has to be experienced the moving wall effect can be quite weird drinks and foodavailable 24 hrs close to the hienejken experince and the riejen museum and van gogh museum and anne frank within walkin distance of the dam amd the main tourist areas too

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room ever”
Reviews.Author: AcePortland_OR
Reviews.Content: Location was very convenient and in an excellent neighborhood. However, the rooms were smallest (we stayed on two separate occassions) we've ever had in Europe. For one person they might have been okay, but for two is was very difficult. Elevator was equally as tiny. At â‚¬140 it seems that there might have been a better choice. Buffet breakfast was basic but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a fair rate”
Reviews.Author: JPHotelier
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went during our break from university to experience this fantastic city. We stayed a total of four nights at the Acro hotel and found it to be perfect for our needs. We had a triple room that was not big, but clean however. The television only played one channel (the others were not free) but really, we did not come to Amsterdam to watch TV. The location of the hotel is almost ideal. The Rijksmuseum is just round the corner, and Van Gogh is about a 3-5 minute walk. The entertainment in Amsterdam is all over, with the red light district being about 20-30 minutes away, which is nice anyway since walking on the streets of Amsterdam is very pleasant, provided that the weather is good. The best coffee shop i would recommend that is close by is called "Dolphins". Ask the reception team and they will help you for sure, they definitely helped us out a great deal during the trip with a lot of helpful tips and advice. The breakfast which is included in the room rate is basic, but better then what i have had at some more expensive hotels. It can be wrapped up in two words. Bread and Spread. If you miss the breakfast there is a great place that sells bagels near the close by casino and hard rock cafe. I had a great time in AMS and would definitely chose this hotel again, due to its location and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Keisha F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great area - close to the Museumplein and a short train ride to Leidesplein. As is to be expected in Amsterdam, there was a long, narrow, winding staircase leading up to the rooms and down to the breakfast area, but there also an old elevator for which I was grateful. The rooms are tiny. The single was large enough for one person, I cannot imagine two people trying to make their way around the room. No more than one person can fit in the narrow area between the bed and the wall. In any case, the rooms were clean, the bathrooms simple with just a toilet and shower. There was a small TV with several channels, many in English. The room rate included breakfast in their morning, served in their breakfast room. It was a typical continent breakfast with cereal, toasts, muffins, juices, etc. A great time-saver for a busy traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect too much or you will be dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: UK2urist
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel as part of a mini cruise break with DFDS ferries from Newcastle and stayed 2 nights with my wife in a double room My son recently stayed in one of the older halls of residence at Newcastle University I would say that and the room we stayed at in the Acro was of a very similar standard with no frills but perfectly functional Room was small with no kettle, luckily I new this so took a travelling kettle with me which I would recommend. There was a small TV which although old and well used worked OK and had BB1, BBC2, and an English news channel, also a few of the Dutch stations were showing English speaking films with Dutch subtitles. The room had toilet / shower facilities which although obviously well used and somewhat run-down did function well with great water pressure from the shower and loads of piping hot water. Bed was hard with only one pillow each but after a long days sightseeing we slept so was ok for us, Room cleanliness was OK but I was surprised that they donâ€™t clean the windows. Dirty on the inside and filthy the outside so much so that it was like looking through frosted glass. Breakfast was self service, toast jam, cheese, ham, salami, hard boiled eggs, cereals, yogurt, tea, coffee, fruit juice, - eat as much as you like 7:30 to 10:30 The breakfast room is in the cellar which can only be accessed via the very steep staircase (If you are at all unsteady on your feet give this hotel a miss). No dining facilities but staff were friendly and gave good suggestions for local restaurants. As we got the hotel as part of a package it is difficult to say weather it is good value for money. A no frills hotel in a good location which is adequate if the price is OK, but donâ€™t go there if you are expecting luxury â€“ Think university halls of residence and you have the Acro hotel

Reviews.Title: “Poky room but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Shilenae
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of this hotel, I wasn't expecting a palace and knew the room may be small, but I was not expecting to find the room was a cupboard. It was stuck on a narrow corridor with reinforced door and you could not move around the bed unless you stood sideways. The window was also extremely hard to open. Staff in the kitchen/diner were a little miserable when asked questions but the receptionists who doubled up as bar staff were quite friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is in an ideal location with leidsplein and other key attractions/bars (incl Anne Frank museum) easy to get to. Despite the small room, my partner and I made the most of it and had a fantastic trip! I would recommend the hotel if you want a cheap and central hotel with absolutely no frills! Would always recommend Amsterdam as it's such a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great time , but on our last night a very tragic accident occurred”
Reviews.Author: HQComics
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, but on the last night of our 8 night stay, a young woman fell to her death from the fourth floor while opening the window. Very tragic and sad, our sympathy for the family. The windows are hard to open, probably due to moisture and their size? So be very careful and do not push to hard. This hotel is a short walk from the museums (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum). Located on a quite street. Coffee shops are a short walk away. Pubs are all over, as in the hotel. Red light district is about a half a hour walk. Or you can rent a bike and make it there in half that time. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small and stairway is steep, but that is typical for Amsterdam. There is a lift. A very beautiful city with lots of friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Awful room, awful hotel, cheap breakfast, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: LLinNYC
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. I am not a terribly picky person-I don't care that the room is small or that they make you return your key to the front desk every time you leave the hotel. However, when paying 100 Euro a night I do expect that 1) that the staff don't smoke in the hotel, 2) that the sheets and towels not feel like sandpaper, and 3) that there is something other than a bare fluorescent bulb in the bathroom and at least a lamp in the room. Other cons: The breakfast was awful. The wireless didn't work on my floor. No one seemed to care one lick and just asked that I use the wireless in the bar instead. This is a fine attitude for first night I was there but this problem persisted for the entire duration of my stay (3 days). Pros about the hotel: great location right across from the museums; quiet and the staff are generally very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: skguider
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Acro. We booked two twin rooms and a triple. The rooms were small but adequate for what we needed and very clean. The room was quite hot even with the window open. There is a small lift but we used the stairs most of the time.The stairs were very steep but typical of Amsterdam. It certainly keeps you fit!! Breakfast was great with a good range of breads, cheeses . meats , cereals and eggs.The breakfast staff were very helpful and quickly topped up anything that was running out. Don't turn up at 9.30am because it got very busy then and you sometimes had to wait for a seat.Go 9 - 9.15 and it was quieter. We got a 3 day tram pass that only cost 15 euros which was great value. You can get a tram 100 metres from the hotel which went into the centre of amsterdam so we used the trams a lot. The staff were very helpful especially when our connexions minibus didn't turn up.They managed to sort everything out and get us to the airport on time. No question was too trivial and they directed us to restaurants , supermarkets, tourist sights etc and you could always get a drink or a cup of coffee. We visited the zoo (great day out), had a day on the hop on hop off canal boat, went to Ann Franks museum(definitely book on line before you go) visited the Rijksmuseum and walked a lot - wear comfy shoes!! Had a great time and would go again and stay at the same hotel .

Reviews.Title: “A great basic hotel in a phenomenal area!”
Reviews.Author: sphinx159
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel -- centrally located near all the major museums, and on a quaint, quiet street for those of us who actually appreciate a good night's sleep. The front desk people were super helpful and friendly. The small rooms and steep stairwells are typical for Amsterdam, so don't blame the hotel for that kind of stuff, and there's no elevator, so make sure you can carry your luggage around yourself, or go stay at a Sheraton. If you want the Dutch experience, this hotel is a great deal, and the location makes it excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more for the price”
Reviews.Author: leeacw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. Perfect place to stay for the budget traveller who wanted a private room with ensuite We were a group of 4 in our late 20s and this was the only one of a handful of places that had rooms with 4 single beds. The room isn't fancy but it was clean and a good size. I had expected a tiny bathroom but it had 2 sinks and was very spacious for european standards. The breakfast included each morning is a nice touch and a good start to the day. Don't expect omelettes or bacon, it's a nice light fare with cold cuts, cheese, toast, etc. The staff at reception was super helpful and they really set the tone of the entire stay. I had the misfortune of the airline losing my luggage and suffering an ankle injury which needed medical attention at the beginning of my stay. With the help of the staff, I was able to get to the nearest tourist medical clinic by taxi and they were also able to coordinate the delivery of my luggage with the airline ensuring it gets through customs. Location is not quite central, but is a quick 15 minute walk to the main square for shopping and dining. Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are literally 2 minutes away from the hotel. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sixpointfour
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for 5 days (including the Queen's Day 2009 celebrations) and was very happy that I chose the Acro for its location (so close to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum that you can easily get there early and near the front of the queues!) and price. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the room I had downstairs was quiet and well-maintained. A variation of the standard, daily breakfast offering would not go amiss, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente!”
Reviews.Author: viajesporakiyporalla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location close to Van Gogh Museum & Volden Hotel has a lift. Rooms are simple, functional & very clean. Staff is great in every way. Buffet breakfast in included.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, great location”
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are small, the location is great and the staff helpful. Breakfast is adequate (but free!) and the location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased but....”
Reviews.Author: kj5556
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, and a super price...very good value for money. The room was very neat tidy and compact, however i was unlucky in that the weather was cold and very wet, and due to the wooden floor, and the the bizzare sighting of the radiator behind the wardrobe, the room was freezing ! It was also not helped by the maid leaving the window wide open every morning ! Aside from this the hotel is a delight, and would be especially nice in the warm summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Staff, Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: HeidBanger
Reviews.Content: Was in Amsterdam for the Holland v Scotland game and had been recommended the Acro, booked at around Â£180 between two of us for two nights and the hotel offered great value for money. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and went out of their way to help you with anything you asked. The rooms were clean and although on the small side were perfect for our trip. Breakfasts in the morning certainly hit the spot as part of the price. The only slight downside was that our room was right beside the stairwell and it could get a bit noisy but all in all fantastic value for money and I will certainly stay there the next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTheGlobe
Reviews.Content: This is a simple, but really good hotel. The front desk staff are super friendly and speak perfect English. The breakfast buffet that is included in your room rate has a nice variety of breads, condiments, cheeses, deli meats, hard-boiled eggs, cereals, yogurt, juices and coffees and teas - a really nice way to start the day. The rooms are simple but comfortable. I reserved a single, but got a double. The entryway into the room is tight and the bathroom isn't for hanging out in, but otherwise the room size was fine. I just wish my little table by the window had a better view! Be careful what you put on the shelf in the bathroom - the toilets have no covers and it's easy to drop something! X-( I agree that it's a little noisy, especially from within the hotel. I could hear the person next door snoring one night and another night had a rowdy bunch of men spend 15 minutes rousing each other for a late night out from the hallway. I don't know if the housekeeping room was above me, but the footfalls were constant. I often stay in hostels, which are usually far noisier, so this was fine for me. As others have said, the location is excellent - just a stone's throw from a tram stop in the Museum District (if traveling from Centraal Station, when you get off at Hobbemastraat, walk back in the direction the tram came from). Central Amsterdam is very walkable and this is a quieter part of the city with quick access to the museums, shops, parks and restaurants. Ask reception for a map. A non-coffeeshop internet cafe was hard to find - they're up near Centraal station. This was my first trip to Amsterdam and I loved everything about it. I would definitely visit and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to find the Hotel Acro. I have been looking for an acceptable $50 hotel (Euro 40 on their web site) in Amsterdam and I have found it. Nothing fancy, but clean and functional. The location is in the museum quarter and you are a stone's throw from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. There are two major tramlines within 100 meters from the hotel. And the walk to the Liedseplein is 5-10 minutes, Not the charm of the canal ring, but very conveniently located. The rooms were very small but functional. Obviously popular with the foreign student crowd, I found the hotel amazingly quiet (I was there on a Tuesday and Wednesday night) despite there being a bar on the lobby level... The breakfast was typical -- breads cheeses, hams, cereals, hard boiled eggs, etc. -- nothing out of the ordinary. If spending time in the hotel is part of your vacation, then this isn't the place. But if you are looking for a safe, inexpensive lodging in the heart of Amsterdam you might have found what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “great central location, excellent facilities and staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nettieandems
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Acro was an excellent find, it offered amazing value for money accomodation in a lovely location. It is situated in a very nice area of amsterdam close to the rijkmuseum and heineken brewery and only a couple of minutes leisurely stroll to the hub of leibspeil with excellent bars, restuarants and shopping. The hotel is just off the main tramline to take you to and from central station. We decided walked everywhere with ease, but transport links are excellent. The accomodation was comfortable and our room was thoroughly cleaned everyday and we were even given extra towels on asking. Breakfast is typically contiential, with lots of delicious cheese, hams, eggs, breads, cereals and fruit. We were stuffed until early evening after a feast! The hotel staff were very friendly, approachable and knowledgable. Special thanks go to Stephen, Berhun and Yoost for all there effort in making our stay a memorable one. Thanks Hotel Acro for making our stay in Amsterdam a dream. I would recommend this hotel to any of my family and friends wishing to have a stress free break to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the Acro Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JoeJourneys
Reviews.Content: The Acro Hotel came as a recommendation and being a seasoned traveler to Amsterdam was concerned about the location and condition of the Hotel Acro. I was pleasantly surprised to find such a great place to stay in Amsterdam so close to all the major attractions, its location is in a very nice part of Amsterdam away from the Red Light District but only a 20 minute walk to reach it and Central Station. Only a short two minute walk to major museums and entertainment, located just round the corner in the Fashion District. For a 2 star hotel you do get great value, okay, the rooms may be small (but this is Amsteram and I've stayed in more expensive hotels with little room to move in), but for the price of your stay its worth the compromise, after all you will be spending all your time in the hotel anyway. All rooms have private ensuite facilities (shower/ toilet), television, hairdryer & FREE Wireless Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stranger_Denmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed here (alone) for three nights a few weeks ago. I needed a friendly, comfortable, inexpensive place to stay while I explored Amsterdam and that is exactly what I got. The free wireless internet (you must bring your own laptop) was a great bonus! Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Acro suited us fine”
Reviews.Author: gonesailingagain
Reviews.Content: Short three day stay at the Acro. Ideal if your on a budget. Great location in nice area of town, near the museums and up-market shopping. Budget flight into Amsterdam, easy train ride from airport. Walked from the station to the Acro...nice stroll, but only had hand luggage. Hotel easy to find, clean, small rooms but all you need really. Breakfast plentiful and fresh, in small downstairs room, a bit busy at times but cosy. Staff friendly and helpful, bar open all hours. For a short break, somewhere to set up base, well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellainec
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a couple of nights in Amsterdam. Couldnt fault the hotel, basic but clean and in a really good location. Rooms were small, however we didnt spend that much time in it The staff were all very friendly and ready to help with any queries. I would recommend this hotel, good as a base to explore. Please be aware of the steps to breakfast room very steep.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation”
Reviews.Author: summertr
Reviews.Content: I greatly appreciate the hospitality, professionality and kindness of Acro's Staff. I felt almost at home during my stay. I lÄ±ked adorable Amterdam and the Dutch a lot. I'll keep all these good memories all my life. Thanks Acro TÃ¼lin YÄ±lmaz from Turkey

Reviews.Title: “OK, but poor sound isolation”
Reviews.Author: peternwalker
Reviews.Content: Booked two double the Acro for two nights as a late choice, the Bellevue being fully booked and other central hotels just being so much more expensive given the decline of the pound against the Euro. As usual for this price range in Amsterdam the double rooms were tiny, only one person being able to move around at a time, but clean and comfortable. Shower room was OK, but so cramped use of the WC was difficult and a non-mixer style shower meant that constant adjustment was required. Overall the hotel is a tad on the shabby side, particularly the lift and stairs, but there is a clean spacious breakfast room that could cope with the nine oâ€™clock rush! Breakfast is included in the room price, and is a an very adequate selection of cold meats, cheeses, breads, breakfast cereals and excellent coffee. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We were concerned at large stag party booking in ahead of us, particularly as the hotel boasts a 24-hour bar, but the management were very quick to resolve noise issues (hip-hop music in the adjacent room on a stag party return at 05:30 on Sunday morning). This highlighted the worst aspect of this hotel, the almost total lack of sound insulation between rooms. Location is not ideal for the central area, being a tram stop from Leidseplein, but trams are very regular so not really a problem up to around 00:30 â€“ and the Rijksmuseum is literally a minutes walk away. Overall reasonable value for money, and would certainly stay again, but given a choice I would plump for the Bellevue which is a similar price but more central, more recently refurbished and has better inter-room acoustic isolation.

Reviews.Title: “What a Blast”
Reviews.Author: xkelzox
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed in the hotel acro for 3 nights we found it a nice and relaxing place room was small but cosy for 2 of us breakfast was pleasent enough but got to get down early for a seat we are coming back to amsterdam in august and will definately be staying in the hotel acro been to amsterdam twice this year the 1st time we stayed along by damm square i prefer being away from all the hustle and bustle i liked it better so much more relaxed and vondel parks just a stone through away from hotel and its gd for just chilling having a few beers and watching the world go by a love amsterdam so much a will defo be a regular visitor just the place to be mind you you have to be open minded bout everythingthats what a like bout the place anything goes and the dutch people are so nice and chilled out unlike the spanish give me the damm over spain anytime cant wait to be back have fun if you are going am sure you will cmon holland for euro 2008 scotland no in it so am supporting holland

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Horrible Noise”
Reviews.Author: LLS1
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel for people in their late teens/early 20s who want a step above a hostel and don't mind a noisy hotel. This hotel is in a good location near Museumplein and a tram stop. However, the accomodations are very basic -- like a university dorm room. The breakfast that came with the room was nice. The front desk staff was fine. The one computer with Internet access was down.We had no air conditioning, so we had to open the windows. Although the hotel is on a quiet residential street, occupants of our hotel and others on the street made noise at all ours of the night. We were several floors up from the street, so that didn't make a difference in noise reduction. Noisy drunken partiers kept us up all night. Closing windows and using air conditioning might have helped, but that wasn't an option available. The fire alarm also went off in the middle of the night because of someone smoking in their room. After two nights with several hours of screaming, laughing and talking keeping us awake for hours, we checked out and into the Amsterdam Mariott for 4 more peaceful evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoyScat
Reviews.Content: A great hotel overall in a great location, next to Vondelpark, really nice to walk around on a Sunday and about 60 seconds from the entrance to the Rijksmuseum. The hotel is situated in a nice residential street with lots of bars and restaurants close by, along with the fabulous American Hotel. The staff are very pleasent and helpful when required, the breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice, ok , the rooms are very small and basic, bathrooms very clean. Ideal for a short stay, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: karthik73
Reviews.Content: We a couple in our 30s stayed at hotel Acro fo 3 nights in the last week of April. That was during the Queens day weekend and all other hotels were fully booked. We paid an average of 120 Euros per night for the room. I was desperate and I had no other choice. In our 3 weeks of travel in France and Netherlands, this was the smallest room we stayed in (and the maximum we paid for). The room I stayed in was on the 4th floor and really tiny, more like a single room converted to a double, There was hardly any space to move about and we had a difficult time placing our luggage. But this is not Bora Bora but Amsterdam. So I guess the room size is OK because we were hardly in our room. The hotel is so conveniently located in the museum district. You can take the Tram 5 and get off at Hobbemastraat and the hotel is 2 minutes away. The happening area that is Leidseplein is 5 minutes by walk. The hip Jordaan area is about 10 minutes by walk. So the location makes up for the small rooms. The room rate includes breakfast and I should mention that the spread is Continental ( no hot food) but quite decent. The front desk staff were very helpful. The bar in the hotel is well stocked and has the 'Amsterdam Ambience'.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Suzieq75
Reviews.Content: Location is great with the Rijk Museum at the top of the street, Vondelpark at the other end of the street and Leidesplein a couple of minutes walk away. The hotel was basic but clean and ideal for a weekend away. The only issue we had was the "Borrowers" upstairs, who we think were staff living on the premises who made lots of noise and would thump about and move furniture for hours on end. We complained and the issue was dealt with by the always friendly staff. Would definitely recommend for a weekend stay on a budget. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: man-bot
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the Acro in October of 2007 and we had a great time! My wife isn't very adventurous when it comes to accomodations and while the Acro is very nice, it isn't a luxury hotel either. Needless to say my wife was very happy escpecially with the neighborhood - the Museumplein is beautiful! The staff at the hotel was exceptionally accomodating - our flight got in around 2 am and they let us check in after only a short wait. They also pour a nice Heineken in the hotel bar too! In short, the hotel from a striaght accomodations point of view isn't anything special - but it is clean enough and the staff are quite helpful (overtly nice is not the way I would describe the Dutch in general - but I'm Canadian so I figure we're just pushovers here ha!) - the location is great though. Beautiful neighborhood and the trams come frequently within a 2 minute walk to wherever you'd like to go. I would stay again definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a nice city...”
Reviews.Author: Braz01
Reviews.Content: A group of mates had been throwing the idea of a long-weekend away and Amsterdam was choosen city. With flights booked it was just a matter of getting a hotel...normally an easy task but when you've got 14 people in the group (all wanting the hotel to be close to the city centre, cheap, clean and have friendly staff) it's not an easy task, and I seemed to have got stuck with the job. After searching the internet (and tripadvisor of course) I finally managed to find a hotel close to the city at a good price that had a good rating & could accomodate the whole group...Hotel Acro. It was a good stay with clean rooms, nice staff (who put up with few late night sessions in the hotel bar...sorry about that fellas), close to public transport (trams and buses), within walking distance of loads of sights (museumplein) as well as bars & clubs (Leidplein). An all-round nice stay really... Late note...If you want cheap transfer to the hotel from schiphol airport get a bus straight to museumplein and the hotel is less then a 5 minute walk away...i think it was the 170 bus but best to ask just to be sure...

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: NY2008
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to crash over night in a quiet and safe place then ACRO is the one to be. I liked the location in a quiet area and still very close to everything, including a supermarket just 3 blocks away and many trams for those which do not wish to walk. I found the staff friendly and ready to help with tourist orientation. I would return to ACRO if they keep the low rates which included also a European breakfast (cold cuts), wireless internet, and all taxes. The convenience of a 24 hours receptionist, open bar, and currency exchange is another plus. I am working in hotel business for 10 years and I know what to expect. This is a 2 stars hotel and offers everything for this category. However, the hotel is simple, not fancy, the comfort is just OK, not first class, if you are expecting more than that just go to 4-5 stars hotels. The single room size was just fine for one person (I have an average body and I can fit almost everywhere, but the big guys may have difficulties in some spaces). The linen was clean, but a little overused, which technically did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fue
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend with a party of 12 friends. Great location & brilliant hotel for the price, would definately stay here again. Basic but very clean rooms, our ensuite room for 4 had an excellent shower & lots of towels. Lots of choice at breakfast & it was included in the price,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - cheap price, top location, clean, comfortable and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: CherryCherryPie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room with a friend during February at the very reasonable price of â‚¬50 for the night. The hotel itself was literally a stones throw away from The Rijksmuseum and also the van Gogh museum yet the room seemed wonderfully quiet and calm even with the window wide open. It's also just a minutes walk from the Hobbemastraat tram stop which is serviced regularly by the number 2 and the number 5 tram from Central Station and the main city areas such as Dam Square. On arrival, half an hour earlier than check-in time, our room was already available and we were able to access it straight away. The room itself was clean and fairly narrow but there was ample space for 2 really comfortable single beds, a 2 seater desk and a wardrobe. The windows were large and airy and the hotel allowed smoking in the rooms (I'm not sure if this was true of all of the rooms so if you are a non- smoker then this may be a negative for you). The en-suite bathroom was small and space to pass by the sink was at a premium but it was functional enough with a good shower and towels provided. Breakfast is served from 7.30 - 10.00 in a good sized downstairs breakfast room. We were welcomed to have some breakfast despite not arriving until 9.55 and there was still plenty of choice with cereals, fruit salad, yoghurts, bread and preserves on offer as well as a selection of cold meats and cheeses and the usual fresh fruit juices and tea/coffee machine. The staff at reception were both friendly and helpful, offering maps and suggestions of good places to eat. On top of this, the hotel offers a luggage storage service so even after check-out, you are welcome to store your luggage leaving you free to further explore the city. Perhaps the only negative we experienced is that we would have liked to have had tea and coffee making facilities in the room itself but this is only a minor downside to a very good value for money hotel. There was also a bar within the hotel which we did not drink at but looked perfectly pleasant. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a fairly cheap and cheerful place to stay when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Acro”
Reviews.Author: Georgiarose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The location was perfect for the Museums and Albert Cuyp Market and Leidseplein. Tram stop one minute walk from hotel. The rooms were compact but large enough for a short break. TV was ok plenty of English speaking channels. The bar was handy and the prices were the same as the bars outside ( 9 Euros for two pints) The breakfast was good with lovely coffee. Overall the hotel was clean very warm and reasonable value for money. Just bar in mind that Amsterdam has become very expensive to eat and drink so fill up on the hotel breakfast, it will keep you going till evening.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Acro Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rivaScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Amsterdam and the hotel Acro with easyjet holidays. Caught the shuttle bus from airport that took us straight to our hotel (38 euro return). Check-in was swift and staff very friendly, we were given a map of Amsterdam and directions for getting into town. The hotel is in a quiet tree lined street, but only 5 minutes from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. Room and bathroom were small, but very clean and perfect for a 4 day trip. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget choice”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTom
